models.brief_description: A graph-based contrastive learning approach using prototypical representations for cell type identification in scRNA-seq data.
models.paper_title: scGPCL: graph prototypical contrastive learning for single-cell RNA-seq clustering

models.authors: Sheng Fang, Xiaokang Yu, et al.
models.brief_description: A contrastive learning framework that focuses on hard sample mining with ZINB-based loss for improved scRNA-seq clustering performance.
models.paper_title: scHSC: enhancing single-cell RNA-seq clustering via hard sample contrastive learning

models.brief_description: A latent diffusion model combined with VAE for generating realistic single-cell gene expression data and data augmentation.
models.paper_title: scDiffusion: conditional generation of high-quality single-cell data using diffusion model

models.full_name: Single-cell data integration with Variational Autoencoder
models.brief_description: A VAE-based method for integrating heterogeneous scRNA-seq datasets across batches while preserving biological variation.
models.paper_title: Online single-cell data integration through projecting heterogeneous datasets into a common cell-embedding space

models.full_name: Cell Basic Local Alignment Search Tool
models.brief_description: A neural network-based cell querying method using VAE for unbiased cell embedding, enabling efficient annotation and identification of novel cell types.
models.paper_title: Searching large-scale scRNA-seq databases via unbiased cell embedding with Cell BLAST

models.brief_description: A GM-VAE approach supporting multiple geometric distributions (Euclidean, Poincaré, PGM, LearnablePGM, HW) for patient-level analysis of single-cell disease atlases.
models.paper_title: PILOT-GM-VAE: patient-level analysis of single-cell disease atlas with optimal transport of Gaussian mixture variational autoencoders

models.brief_description: A graph neural network framework that formulates relationships between cells using cell-cell graphs and leverages autoencoders with LTMG for imputation and clustering.
models.paper_title: scGNN is a novel graph neural network framework for single-cell RNA-Seq analyses

models.brief_description: A deep learning approach combining autoencoders with DEC-style clustering for unsupervised cell type identification in scRNA-seq data.
models.paper_title: Clustering single-cell RNA-seq data with a model-based deep learning approach

models.brief_description: A hyperbolic VAE that embeds scRNA-seq data in Poincaré space to preserve hierarchical cell relationships for visualization and analysis.
models.paper_title: scDHMap: hyperbolic variational autoencoder for single-cell transcriptomics embedding

models.authors: Tian SW, Ni JC, et al.
models.brief_description: A graph contrastive clustering framework using graph attention networks with neighborhood augmentations for scRNA-seq data analysis.
models.paper_title: scGCC: Graph Contrastive Clustering With Neighborhood Augmentations for scRNA-Seq Data Analysis
models.journal: IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics

models.authors: Wenkai Han, Yuqi Cheng, et al.
models.brief_description: A self-supervised contrastive learning framework for scRNA-seq data representation that handles batch effects and dropout events simultaneously.
models.paper_title: Self-supervised contrastive learning for integrative single cell RNA-seq data analysis

models.brief_description: A linear dimensionality reduction technique that identifies orthogonal principal components maximizing variance in the data. Widely used for preprocessing and visualization in single-cell analysis.
models.paper_title: On Lines and Planes of Closest Fit to Systems of Points in Space

models.brief_description: A computational method for separating multivariate signals into statistically independent non-Gaussian components. Used in single-cell analysis to identify independent sources of variation.
models.paper_title: Independent component analysis, A new concept?

models.brief_description: A statistical method identifying latent factors that explain correlations among observed variables. Models data as linear combinations of latent factors plus noise, useful for identifying gene modules.
models.paper_title: General Intelligence, Objectively Determined and Measured

models.authors: Daniel D. Lee, H. Sebastian Seung
models.brief_description: A matrix factorization technique constraining both factors to be non-negative, producing parts-based representations. Ideal for gene expression data where negative values are not meaningful.
models.paper_title: Learning the parts of objects by non-negative matrix factorization

models.authors: Bernhard Schölkopf, Alexander Smola, Klaus-Robert Müller
models.brief_description: A non-linear extension of PCA using kernel methods to project data into higher-dimensional feature spaces, capturing non-linear relationships in single-cell data.
models.paper_title: Kernel principal component analysis
models.journal: International Conference on Artificial Neural Networks

models.brief_description: A matrix decomposition technique computing only the k largest singular values, efficient for large sparse matrices. Forms the basis of LSI/LSA and is commonly used for scRNA-seq preprocessing.
models.paper_title: Calculating the Singular Values and Pseudo-Inverse of a Matrix

models.authors: Julien Mairal, Francis Bach, Jean Ponce, Guillermo Sapiro
models.brief_description: A representation learning method that learns a dictionary of basis elements and sparse codes. Produces interpretable sparse representations of single-cell gene expression patterns.
models.paper_title: Online Dictionary Learning for Sparse Coding

models.authors: Scott Deerwester, Susan Dumais, George Furnas, Thomas Landauer, Richard Harshman
models.brief_description: A dimensionality reduction technique using SVD on TF-IDF weighted matrices. Adapted for scATAC-seq analysis to reduce chromatin accessibility data while preserving biological signal.
models.paper_title: Indexing by Latent Semantic Analysis
models.journal: Journal of the American Society for Information Science

models.authors: Tal Ashuach, Daniel A. Reidenbach, Nir Yosef
models.brief_description: A deep generative model for scATAC-seq data using variational inference with Bernoulli likelihood. Learns cell embeddings while accounting for cell-specific and region-specific technical effects.
models.paper_title: PeakVI: A Deep Generative Model For Single Cell Chromatin Accessibility Analysis

models.brief_description: A variational autoencoder for scATAC-seq fragment count data using Poisson likelihood. Designed for quantitative chromatin accessibility analysis with proper count-based modeling.
models.paper_title: PoissonVI: Analyzing quantitative scATAC-seq fragment counts

categories.name: Variational Autoencoder
categories.description: Models based on VAE architecture for learning latent representations

categories.name: Contrastive Learning
categories.description: Models using contrastive learning objectives for representation learning

categories.name: Graph Neural Network
categories.description: Models leveraging graph structures for cell relationship modeling

categories.name: Clustering
categories.description: Models focused on unsupervised clustering of single cells

categories.name: Classical Machine Learning
categories.description: Traditional dimensionality reduction and matrix factorization methods

categories.name: ATAC-specific Methods
categories.description: Methods specifically designed for scATAC-seq chromatin accessibility data
